intro: Danais humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's danais, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Danais humbertii is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
